input.message:
After a time, she heard a little pattering of feet in the distance and she hastily dried her eyes to see what was coming. It was the White Rabbit returning, splendidly dressed, with a pair of white kid-gloves in one hand and a large fan in the other. He[Pg 10] came trotting along in a great hurry, muttering to himself, "Oh! the Duchess, the Duchess! Oh! won't she be savage if I've kept her waiting!"
When the Rabbit came near her, Alice began, in a low, timid voice, "If you please, sirâ€”" The Rabbit started violently, dropped the white kid-gloves and the fan and skurried away into the darkness as hard as he could go.
Alice took up the fan and gloves and she kept fanning herself all the time she went on talking. "Dear, dear! How queer everything is to-day! And yesterday things went on just as usual. Was I the same when I got up this morning? But if I'm not the same, the next question is, 'Who in the world am I?' Ah, that's the great puzzle!"

output.message: In this passage from 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland,' Alice encounters the White Rabbit, who is anxiously rushing about, indicating a time-sensitive situation. The scene takes place in a whimsical, fantastical setting where Alice is grappling with her identity and the strange changes she is experiencing. The central conflict revolves around Alice's confusion and curiosity about herself and her surroundings, as she questions her own identity and the surreal nature of her reality. This moment encapsulates the overarching theme of self-discovery and the exploration of one's existence in a bizarre world.
